PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, February 28, 1942, pg. 21, reads: "Country's Dance Lovers Pay Homage to Count Basie During Series of Coronation Dances - Getting off to a tremendous initial drive in Kansas City and moving into a thrilling anti-climax in Wheeling, W. Va., the third annual coronation dances of The Pittsburgh Courier, under the sponsorship of the top dance promoters in chosen sections, captured the attention of many thousand dance and music lovers. At each stop Count Basie and his men of syncopation were lauded for their great musical ability and talent which stood them in good stead, winning for them two of the paper's annual band concerts...  In the last photo, Basie and all the boys in the band pause for a taste of Pabst Blue ribbon beer, product of the company which donated the superb trophies honoring him and his men.  These scenes were taken in Kansas City, St. Louis, Akron, and Wheeling."
TitMainTitle: Count Basie seated at piano surrounded by band members with bottles of Pabst Blue Ribbon Beer, including Jimmy Rushing, Walter Page, Jack Washington, Dickie Wells, Ed Lewis, Buddy Tate, Jo Jones, and Buck Clayton, with trophy on piano inscribed "Count Basie King of Pittsburgh Courier Band Contest 1942," Wheeling, West Virginia
CatSubject_tab: Men--West Virginia--Wheeling.Musicians--West Virginia--Wheeling.Musical instruments--West Virginia--Wheeling.Bands (Music)--West Virginia--Wheeling.Basie, Count, 1904-1984.Piano--West Virginia--Wheeling.
